intro: Campylospermum dependens var. maromandiae, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant in warm climates.
